item.title: Infectious Disease Epidemiology - A model-based approach
item.description:
Infectious Disease Epidemiology - A model-based approach (IDEMA) is an online course I teach at the University of Georgia. All course materials (or links to the materials) are available in the form of a simple GitHub website and can be used by anyone. You can find the course on this site.

The course also makes heavy use of my IDEMA online book and the DSAIDE R package.

item.title: Simulation Modeling in Immunology
item.description:
Simulation Modeling in Immunology (SMI) is an annual workshop that I co-teach with my colleague Paul Thomas. It usually occurs each year in July in Seattle. In 2020 we taught it online. All course materials are available in the form of a simple GitHub website and can be used by anyone for self-learning. You can find the course on this site.

The course makes heavy use of my DSAIRM R package.

item.title: Modern Applied Data Analysis
item.description: Modern Applied Data Analysis (MADA) is a course I regularly teach online. All course materials are available in the form of a simple GitHub website and can be used by anyone for self-learning. You can find the course on this site.
